bibl.title: Gus Bendjus et al. vs Territory of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the district court holding terms at Territory of Washington, v.s. Gus Bendjust, et al.
Olympia, In the making of the application on Petition of certain persons for a writ of Habeas Corpus

Whereas it appears by the petition of Bill Frederickson duly verified, that certain persons are ilegally imprisoned by William Billings, Sheriff of thurston County, Washington Territory, presented to me this day.
Now, in the Name of the United States of America: to William Billings, Sheriff of Thurston County, W.T., greeting:

We command you to have the bodies of Gus Bendjus, Robert Stranghauet, Ben Fredrickson, Frank Nelson, Andrew Johnson, Leander Brown, John Thompson, Alex Green and Thomas Jacobs, by you detained and imprisoned, as in said petetion alleged, before the Judge of the second Judicial district at his chambers at the City of Tacoma at the Court house in said city, together with the cause or causes of their detention and imprisonment, to do a and receive what shall be ordered concerning them, and have you then and there this Writ, with your return attached there to, on the 13" day of October 1887, at the hour of ten o clock A.M. Witness the Honorable Frank Allyn, Judge of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, this 6" day of October 1887.
The clerk is hereby directed to issue the foregoing Writ at once, and delivered to said Sheriff without delay. At Chambers Oct. 6" 1887.
Territory of Washington versus Gus Bendjust et al.
Writ of Habeas Corpus. Received at this office and filled on the 21st day of October 1887. HW Sutton, Clerk
Fees of the Sheriff of Chehalis County in return of defendants Gus Bendjus et al from Tacoma and Olympia.
Mileage of 9 prisoners 40 miles each, 1 guard 36.00
Per Driver, 2 days at 2.00 per day. 4.00. 4.00 Serving order for return of prisoners to Olympia. 6.00. 9.00. 59.00.
